subject: RE: [junit] Do JUnit internals suck?!?
messageBody:
> I don't believe it makes sense to put rerun logic in the base class if
> all of the runners don't use it.

You could use the strategy pattern (one strategy is running with reloading, one
without) to do that.

My idea is to first have a clean separation between the BaseTestRunner and its
listners (the AWT, Swing and Text runners), implement a clean MVC and allow
users to define their own listeners. Providing an XML writer as a standard
listener would also be cool.

Once the separation is in place, you can freely refactor the BaseTestRunner to
use strategies (or something else) if there's a need.

I don't believe that changing the order of these refactorings would bring must
success. But that's only my opinion.

-Vladimir
